content: Welcome aboard. I find it refreshing to see an ambitious young person who is focused. The route you're speaking of is the same as I took. Every police agency has needs that are found in other than former M/P positions. Computer skills, chemistry, teaching, second languages, accounting, etc., can be more valuable than what you suggested. There's plenty of needs to encourage you to do what you like. Please do not dismiss college. Most LE agencies are very competitive. You will be cheating yourself by not getting a degree. It will be lots easier now to accomplish than later. Did you know the Army has a helicopter pilot program that only requires a HS diploma? Good luck. This message has been edited. Last edited by: scpd3045, Sun 03 May 2009 01:02 PM

content: quote: Originally posted by future_mp_pace: so my future and ultimate goal is to become a deputy sheriff in san bernardino county, ca, usa. I looked at the navy, air force and army. I am looking for a job as a military police officer, but am confused what branch i should join. any suggestions? i want to join the branch most closely related to being a regular police officer. i appreciate your help I'm prior Coast Guard and don't really care if the USCG is not your thing. Heck, it didn't bother me one bit when my son chose the Marine Corps. But......just to give you another idea, if you go Coast Guard, all that experience you might get as a Boarding Officer or Boarding Team Member could be useful in getting a job with a Sheriff's Office. Arrests, seizures, searching for compartments and drugs, evidence custody, reports, testifying in court, etc. My six years in the Coast Guard was the only reason I was later hired to run boats for U.S. Customs. Did that for 17 yrs before I had to retire as a GS-12 for a Disability. I know nothing about San Bernadino but if they have a Marine Unit, all the better for you if you were a Coast Guard Coxswain/Boarding Officer....that is, if you have the slightest interest in boats. Your call, whatever makes you the happiest. Good luck, Don

content: Becoming an MP Officer in the Army is the best way to go. My Son had a chance to become an Officer in the MPs but turned it down because he was in charge of a section of young MPs when assigned to the 82nd MP Company. He had three years of college and made E-8 in 14 years. Not too bad IMO. He really liked it from the enlisted side and knew that if he became an Officer he would be stuck behind a desk and he did not want that.

content: The marine bureau is an often sought job within a police department. We have plenty of guys with boating skills who apply, but you know who got the job easy? It was a cop who's a master mechanic. They want someone who can rip off the cowling and jumpstart a dead endine, particularly in the freezing weather. His mechanical skills were more important than someone possessing a PHD in Criminal Justice.
